intro: Syngonanthus candidus, commonly known as the white-flowered everlet, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often woody. Syngonanthus candidus is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
